IFCS will investigate infection control incidents and root causes, as well as contribute to the development and delivery of education to improve the infection control of the facility. This aspect will be enhanced by hands\\-on clinical supervision support and accomplished through frequent rounding, interaction, and collaboration with both the clinical staff and hospital leadership to evaluate and implement improvements to clinical operations.


Experience with complex, acute patient care is a must; success will be dependent on being able to truly relate and work with the staff.
